title: Liverpool transfer news: Reds star Emre Can is a shock target for Italian giants Juventus this summer
text:
JUVE CAN COME HERE Liverpool transfer news: Reds star Emre Can is a shock target for Italian giants Juventus this summer 
Serie A champions intent on pinching German international whose Anfield contract runs out in 2018. Gossip Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments Liverpool could have a fight on their hands to keep hold of one of their best midfielders, Emre Can. 
Serie A champions Juventus are circling around the German who has struggled to find his best form this season. Reuters 3 Liverpool midfielder Emre Can linked with a move to Serie A giants Juventus 
The former Bayer Leverkusen star’s contract at Anfield runs until the end of the 2018 season, with talks over a new deal failing to really take charge. 
Keep up to date with ALL the LIVERPOOL news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And according to the Daily Star that’s where Juventus are planning to come in and lure the midfielder away from Anfield. 
Can’s hit three goals so far this season, but has only featured in 19 games and after Liverpool’s title collapse in January, does he see his future away from Merseyside? Should Can depart Anfield, Liverpool would be keen to replace him. 
Jurgen Klopp has long been an admirer of Borussia Mönchengladbach’s Mahmoud Dahoud, but according to reports in Italy, Juventus are after him too! 
With Juve able to offer Champions League football, it highlights the importance of a top four finish, if Liverpool are to compete with the big-boys in the transfer market. Liverpool 2-0 Tottenham : Liverpool win for the first time this year 
Elsewhere, Daniel Sturridge has had to withdraw from Liverpool's mid-season training camp in La Managa with a virus. 
The striker joined up with the squad on Tuesday despite feeling unwell, but has had to fly home early. 
Liverpool aren't in FA Cup action this weekend after being knocked out by Wolves in the fourth round, their next game is in 11 days time against Leicester City.
